unnormalised: I remember when my cousin, Raju, almost dropped out after 10th standard. His family's financial situation was really bad, and they couldn't afford the fees for senior secondary at a private school. Luckily, his schoolteacher told them about the "Mukhyamantri Shiksha Protsahan Yojana". They applied, and Raju got a scholarship that covered 75% of his fees! It was a huge relief. He's now doing his B.Sc. at a local college, hoping to get a government job after. Schemes like these, even with their flaws, actually give people a chance. More awareness abt them is needed tho.
normalised: I remember when my cousin, Raju, almost dropped out after tenth standard. His family's financial situation was really bad, and they couldn't afford the fees for senior secondary at a private school. Luckily, his schoolteacher told them about the "Mukhyamantri Shiksha Protsahan Yojana". They applied, and Raju got a scholarship that covered seventy five percent of his fees! It was a huge relief. He's now doing his B-S-c. at a local college, hoping to get a government job after. Schemes like these, even with their flaws, actually give people a chance. More awareness about them is needed though.
